pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru
meanings: doing something from beginning to end
being unchanged from beginning to end

lessons.japanese: 学生たちは終始じっと座っていた。
lessons.english: The students sat still all the time.

lessons.japanese: 彼は私たちが一緒に働いていたとき終始私をからかっていた。
lessons.english: He was always pulling my leg when we worked together.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は落ち着いた態度に終始した。
彼は私たちが一緒に働いていたとき終始私をからかっていた。
lessons.english: He was always pulling my leg when we worked together.

lessons.japanese: 当人の終始変わらない努力が最後にものを言うのである。
lessons.english: It is your constant efforts that count most in the end.

lessons.japanese: 前の会社では何でも屋に終始したので今度は専門職に就きたい。
lessons.english: I wore several hats at my last office so I'd like to specialize this time.

lessons.japanese: 終始勉強ばかりしていないで、たまには外出して楽しみなさい。
lessons.english: Go out and have a good time once in a while instead of just studying all the time.

lessons.japanese: 試合は終始一点を争うシーソーゲームだった。
lessons.english: The game was one point back and forth the whole game.

lessons.japanese: 私服警官が終始大統領の身辺を固めていた。
lessons.english: The private detectives accompanied the President everywhere.

lessons.japanese: 学生たちは終始じっと座っていた。
lessons.english: The students sat still all the time.

lessons.english: Go out and have a good time once in a while instead of just studying all the time.

lessons.english: I wore several hats at my last office so I'd like to specialize this time.

lessons.english: It is your constant efforts that count most in the end.
